questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
Which tag is used to create a level one heading?
Which pair of tags wraps the visible content of a webpage?

html.end: Move on to learn more about HTML Foundations!

html.description: Click "start" to test your HTML basic structuring skills and knowledge!

html.name: HTML Common Tags
html.description: Click "start" to see how many common HTML tags you know so far!

questions.question: Which tag and attribute is used to create links?
Which tag is used to make list items?

html.name: HTML Visuals
html.description: Click "start" to test your HTML visual element skills and knowledge!

questions.question: What does the <tr> tag do?
options: It creates data cells in a table
It creates rows in a table
It creates a column in a table

questions.question: How to embed another web page on your own web page?
What does the <circle> tag do?
options: It creates a circle in a PNG file
It creates a circle in inline SVG

questions.question: How to put a video on your web page?

html.end: Good job, you finished the HTML Visuals unit! Move on and explore efficient code writing and user handling!

questions.question: Which HTML entity is syntaxed correctly?
What's the semantic tag for creating image captions?

html.end: Good job, you finished the Efficient Code unit! Move on and explore how to handle users on your website!

html.name: HTML Handling Users
html.description: Click "start" to test your HTML user handling skills and knowledge!

questions.question: Which tag is used for multiple choice options?
Which input type attribute is used to create an encoded input?

html.end: Congratulations, you finished the Handling Users unit and completed the HTML Course on MacLearn! Way to go!

css.name: Meeting CSS
css.description: Click "start" to see what you know about the very basics of what CSS is and how to add it to your website!

questions.question: What does CSS do?
options: It adds functionality to a website.
It's a database system used in web servers.
It styles the design of a website.

css.end: Move on to learn more CSS properties and tricks!

css.name: CSS Colors
css.description: Click "start" to see what you know about basic CSS syntax and implementation!

questions.question: Which CSS property sets an element's text color?
How to make an element's background a gradient?
What's wrong with this code: border: 2px circles black;
options: There's nothing wrong with this code.
The "black" value isn't a valid color.
The "circles" value isn't a valid border style.

css.end: Move on to learn more CSS properties and tricks!

css.name: Adding Space
css.description: Click "start" to see what you know about adding space and resizing elements in CSS!

questions.question: Which CSS properties set an element's width and height?
How to add space that takes up 20 pixels inside an element?
What does CSS box model do?
options: It creates many boxes on the page.
It styles elements to make them rectangular.
It arranges the elements to be the shape of a box.
It tells the browser how to render the spaces of an element.

css.end: Move on to learn more CSS properties and tricks!

css.name: Text & Content
css.description: Click "start" to see what you know about styling the text and content on your webpage using CSS!

questions.question: Which CSS property determines whether or not a text is italicized?
How to change the line height of a pragraph to 30 pixels using CSS?
What does "margin-inline: auto" do?
options: It removes all the margin on an element.
It gives an element as much margin on the left/right as possible.
It changes the margin on the left/right of an element so the element's size is fixed.
It adds a random amount of margin on the left/right of an element.

css.end: Move on to learn more CSS properties and tricks!

css.name: Laying Out Stuff
css.description: Click "start" to see what you know about arranging elements and content on your webpage using CSS!

questions.question: Which CSS property determines how an element is being displayed?
How to align some elements in the center of the flexbox's axis?
What does "z-index: 100;" do?
options: It brings an element to the 100th 3D layer on the page.
It gives an element an index to make search engines index the site better.
It moves the element 100 pixels right.
It moves the element 100 pixels down.

css.end: Move on to learn more CSS properties and tricks!

css.name: Useful Tips
css.description: Click "start" to see what you know about CSS math, variables, !important, and more!

questions.question: Which CSS value function performs math on different units in CSS?
How to make a rule in a type selector override inline styles?
What does the ":after" pseudo class do?
options: It applies styles to an element after it's being hovered.
It creates an extension of an element after the element.
It applies styles to an element after it's being clicked.
It moves the element to the end of the document.

css.end: Move on to learn more CSS properties and tricks!

css.name: Creating Animations
css.description: Click "start" to see what you know about making smooth transitions and animations with transform properties!

questions.question: Which CSS transition value defines the transition delay in this example? transition: background-color 0.5s 1s ease
Which CSS rule defines an animation?
What does "transform: rotate(50deg);" do?
options: The "transform" property doesn't have a rotate function.
It moves an element to the right by 50 pixels.
It rotates the element by 50 degrees clockwise.
It rotates the element by 50 degrees counterclockwise.

css.end: Move on to learn more CSS properties and tricks!

css.name: Responsive Design
css.description: Click "start" to see what you know about making your website usable across different devices!

questions.question: Which CSS rule defines how an element should behave when a screen size condition is met?
Which HTML tag is used to define the viewport behavior?

What is wrong with this example:
 media (max-width: 500px) {...CSS code here}
options: There shouldn't be parentheses around the condition.
The media rule is missing the @ symbol.

css.end: Move on to learn more CSS properties and tricks!
